greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n, k) is the number of unlabeled connected planar simple graphs with n >= 1 nodes and 0<=k<=3*n-6 edges.
comment: Planar graphs with n >= 3 nodes have at most 3*n-6 edges.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..147 (rows 1..11)
F. Harary, The number of linear, directed, rooted, and connected graphs, Trans. Amer. Math. Soc. 78 (1955), 445-463. (MR0068198) See page 457, equation (2.9).
formula: T(n, n-1) = A000055(n) and Sum_{k} T(n, k) = A003094(n) if n>=1. - _Michael Somos_, Aug 23 2015
log(1 + B(x, y)) = Sum{n>0} A(x^n, y^n) / n where A(x, y) = Sum_{n>0, k>=0} T(n,k) * x^n * y^k and similarly B(x, y) with A039735. - _Michael Somos_, Aug 23 2015
results.author: _Brendan McKay_
